course_name: Professional Practice & Emerging Issues in Occupational Health and Safety
description: This course examines the emergence of OHS as a profession and discusses the implications of professional practice for graduates. Students will explore ethics, leadership, organisational culture and industrial relations in relation to OHS. Contemporary OHS issues such as worker demographics and globalisation of the labour market, work organisation and fatigue will be discussed. Students will also develop skills in preparing business cases and undertaking cost-benefit analyses for OHS interventions.
